alert.note: Alert for Grafton (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 10 at 2:33PM EDT until July 11 at 5:40PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of western Maine, including the following county, Oxford. Portions of northern New Hampshire, including the following counties, Carroll, Coos and Grafton. * WHEN...Until 445 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 232 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen over the last 4 to 5 hours. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Conway, Berlin, Bethel, Bethlehem, Lincoln, Franconia, Pinkham Notch, Mount Washington, Tamworth and Sandwich.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
